remarks: Prove a property of polynomials by "structural" induction, under a simplified model of structure which loses the sum of products structure.  The commutativity condition is stronger than strictly needed.  (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 11-Mar-2015.)
statement:
mplind.sk $e |- K = ( Base ` R ) $.
mplind.sv $e |- V = ( I mVar R ) $.
mplind.sy $e |- Y = ( I mPoly R ) $.
mplind.sp $e |- .+ = ( +g ` Y ) $.
mplind.st $e |- .x. = ( .r ` Y ) $.
mplind.sc $e |- C = ( algSc ` Y ) $.
mplind.sb $e |- B = ( Base ` Y ) $.
mplind.p $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. H /\ y e. H ) ) -> ( x .+ y ) e. H ) $.
mplind.t $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. H /\ y e. H ) ) -> ( x .x. y ) e. H ) $.
mplind.s $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. K ) -> ( C ` x ) e. H ) $.
mplind.v $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. I ) -> ( V ` x ) e. H ) $.
mplind.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. B ) $.
mplind.i $e |- ( ph -> I e. _V ) $.
mplind.r $e |- ( ph -> R e. CRing ) $.
mplind $p |- ( ph -> X e. H ) $.
$d .+ x y $.
$d .x. x y $.
$d B x y $.
$d C x y $.
$d H x y $.
$d I x $.
$d K x $.
$d V x $.
$d Y x y $.
$d ph x y $.
